text: Hi everyone, is there an alternative way to cache file types in HS? I'm trying to optimize a website but it looks like this is impossible since HS is the one controlling the hosting. thanks.
HubSpot handles all of the minification caching, database caching, file combination, as well as with your help they also do the image optimization.
you have little to no control over how it’s done
Got it, do you have any suggestions for optimizing a website other than caching?
really it’s down to standard front end web dev stuff. Make sure images are properly sized(use resize_image_url for that). follow the speed recommendations in chrome audits.
don’t load a ton of fonts. you can kill white-space by putting a `-` in your HubL tags taking out a little bit of the html and css weight
Thanks, Jon - unfortunately, I've done all of that, caching the file types is the only thing left in the PageSpeed Insight audit.
Which files are not being cached?

I'm using PageSpeed Insights and one of the suggestions is to cache the file types - most of them are external js (analytics, wistia, etc.), so I'm trying to find a workaround for modifying the .htaccess file. But I'm thinking I can just add a script to defer js files.

i have a dynamic template being used for listing and detail page. the detail page has a form inside a module and i want to attach a follow up email when the form gets submitted. How do i do this in the form embed code?
